goal: To hold a razor blade properly for shaving.

Getting behind the neck can be tricky and you may have to modify your grip.
sol2: Many people use a pinched grip like they are holding a pencil or throwing a dart. You have much more control if you hold razor in between the handle and razor. goal: How to Make a Stimulating Hair Mask
sol1: After you have shampooed and washed you hair through keep your hair damp. Grab a bowl and put about 4 tablespoons of honey and then mix in a few drops of castor oil. Once that's mixed, take your immersion blender, and mix in a few cups of freshly brewed coffee, and lighten with a bit of creamer. When you feel you’ve applied enough put a small amount of your regular conditioner in your hair and rub in while you do this add the honey and castor oil mix. Put your hair in a shower cap and leave your hair mask to soak into the scalp for 20 minutes. If you have a hair steamer this will help open your hair pores. Once you have let your scalp soak up the ingredients, wash the hair mask out.
sol2: After you have shampooed and washed you hair through keep your hair damp. Grab a bowl and put about 4 tablespoons of honey and then mix in a few drops of castor oil. Once that's mixed, release your hair from the shower cap/towel/ bun and pour a few drops of peppermint oil in palm of your hand. When you feel you’ve applied enough put a small amount of your regular conditioner in your hair and rub in while you do this add the honey and castor oil mix. Put your hair in a shower cap and leave your hair mask to soak into the scalp for 20 minutes. If you have a hair steamer this will help open your hair pores. Once you have let your scalp soak up the ingredients, wash the hair mask out.

goal: How to make white  Chocolate maple Crunch at home.
sol1: Mix 3 cups granulated sugar,  3/4 cup margarine, and  2/3 cup evaporated milk in a large, heavy saucepan over medium heat, stirring to dissolve sugar. Bring mixture to a full boil for 5 minutes, stirring constantly.  Remove from heat and stir in 12 ounce bag of white chocolate chips until thoroughly combined. Beat in 1 7 ounce jar of marshmallow creme, 1/2 cup Maple syrup, and 3/4 cup chopped granola, 2 cup rice noodles and 1 teaspoon vanilla extract.  Transfer fudge to Greased 8 x 13" pan and let cool before cutting into squares.
sol2: Mix 3 cups granulated sugar,  3/4 cup margarine, and  2/3 cup evaporated milk in a large, heavy saucepan over medium heat, stirring to dissolve sugar. Bring mixture to a full boil for 5 minutes, stirring constantly.  Remove from heat and stir in 12 ounce bag of white chocolate chips until thoroughly combined. Beat in 1 7 ounce jar of marshmallow creme, 1/2 cup Maple syrup, and 3/4 cup chopped granola, 1/2 cup rice crispies and 1 teaspoon vanilla extract.  Transfer fudge to Greased 8 x 13" pan and let cool before cutting into squares.

goal: How to clean a glass stovetop.
sol1: Pour white vinegar into a small spray bottle. Spray the vinegar evenly onto your stovetop.Then sprinkle baking soda evenly across your stovetop. The baking soda will react with the vinegar, creating a fizzy cleaner that will loosen up grease and grime.Next, put a few drops of Dawn into a bucket or your sink, and fill it with hot water.Dunk your towel into the soapy water, then wring it out lightly so that it’s wet but not dripping.Spread the wet towel over the stovetop, covering the baking soda and vinegar. Let it sit for about 15 minutes.Remove the towel and wipe away the remaining baking soda. To finish off, give your stovetop another spray with the vinegar, and use a microfiber cloth to buff it to a sparkling shine.
sol2: Pour white vinegar into a small spray bottle. Spray the vinegar evenly onto your stovetop.Then sprinkle baking soda evenly across your stovetop. The baking soda will react with the vinegar, creating a fizzy cleaner that will loosen up grease and grime.Next, put a few drops of Dawn into a bucket or your sink, and fill it with cold water.Dunk your towel into the soapy water, then wring it out lightly so that it’s wet but not dripping.Spread the wet towel over the stovetop, covering the baking soda and vinegar. Let it sit for about 15 minutes.Remove the towel and wipe away the remaining baking soda. To finish off, give your stovetop another spray with the vinegar, and use a microfiber cloth to buff it to a sparkling shine.

goal: How to Clean Green Spot/Dust Algae off Aquarium Glass
sol1: Green spot or green dust algae is a common issue in planted tanks, because its common when there is an excess of nutrients and an excess of light in the tank. You can slow its growth by reducing fertilization, increasing water changes and reducing the intensity and duration of your lights. You'll probably also have to remove it manually, a good way to do it is to use a credit card and a magic eraser sponge, or an aquarium algae scraper tool. You can also keep Mystery or Nerite snails or otocinclus catfish are great algae eaters and good for peaceful, community tanks.
sol2: Green spot or green dust algae is a common issue in planted tanks, because its common when there is an excess of nutrients and an excess of light in the tank. You can slow its growth by reducing fertilization, decreasing water changes and increasing the intensity and duration of your lights. You'll probably also have to remove it manually, a good way to do it is to use a credit card and a magic eraser sponge, or an aquarium algae scraper tool. You can also keep Mystery or Nerite snails or otocinclus catfish are great algae eaters and good for peaceful, community tanks.

goal: how to find the big dipper
sol1: If you can find the North Star, you should be able to find the Big Dipper, and vice versa. The North Star is usually bright. To find it, look into the north sky up about one third of the way from the horizon to the top of the sky (which is called the zenith). The North Star is also called Polaris.
sol2: If you can find the North Star, you should be able to find the Big Dipper, and vice versa. The south Star is usually bright. To find it, look into the north sky up about one third of the way from the horizon to the top of the sky (which is called the zenith). The south Star is also called Polaris.

goal: Prevent infestation of cutting insects on trees.

goal: To make spiced salt

Transfer the ingredients to a mixer grinder and grind to a fine powder.
sol2: Dry fry one cup of table salt in a frying pan. When it starts to crackle, move it to a metal bowl to cool. goal: spicy fried rice

goal: how do I make damper?
sol1: 2 cups self-raising flour    1 tablespoon sugar    1 tablespoon butter    1 cup milk extra for brushing    Instructions    Preheat oven to 180C.    Line a baking tray with baking paper.    In a large bowl, stir together flour, sugar and a generous pinch of salt.    Add the butter and rub in with your fingertips.    Add the milk and stir it in with a butter knife. The dough should be fairly soft, but not too sticky.    Turn out onto a lightly floured board and shape into a soft smooth ball.    Cut a cross shape into the top of the damper and brush with a little milk.    Bake for 30 minutes or until golden.
sol2: 2 cups self-raising biscuits    1 tablespoon sugar    1 tablespoon butter    1 cup milk extra for brushing    Instructions    Preheat oven to 180C.    Line a baking tray with baking paper.    In a large bowl, stir together flour, sugar and a generous pinch of salt.    Add the butter and rub in with your fingertips.    Add the milk and stir it in with a butter knife. The dough should be fairly soft, but not too sticky.    Turn out onto a lightly floured board and shape into a soft smooth ball.    Cut a cross shape into the top of the damper and brush with a little milk.    Bake for 30 minutes or until golden.

goal: How to Make Huckleberry cobbler at home.
sol1: Wash  1 fresh or frozen wild huckleberry toss 1 berry with 3 tablespoons Lemon juice.  Use Pillsbury Cinnamon roll(tube type) from refrigerated section in the market, with rolling pin, roll to less than 1/2 inch thick.  Line the base of a deep metal baking pan/dish with the dough.  Reserve approx. 1/3 of dough for cover.  (You will place this on top after you finish preparing the filling.)  Place huckleberries in dish atop the roll dough.  Sprinkle 1 cup granulated sugar, 2 tbs. Brown sugar 1 tablespoons cinnamon, 1/2 cup butter (In small pieces), on top.  Sprinkle 1/2 tablespoon of salt atop.  Place crust over everything.  Bake in the oven at 375 for 40 min.  Remove from oven when crust brown and pie is bubbly.  Enjoy.
sol2: Wash  4 cups fresh or frozen wild huckleberries toss berries with 3 tablespoons Lemon juice.  Use Pillsbury Cinnamon roll(tube type) from refrigerated section in the market, with rolling pin, roll to less than 1/2 inch thick.  Line the base of a deep metal baking pan/dish with the dough.  Reserve approx. 1/3 of dough for cover.  (You will place this on top after you finish preparing the filling.)  Place huckleberries in dish atop the roll dough.  Sprinkle 1 cup granulated sugar, 2 tbs. Brown sugar 1 tablespoons cinnamon, 1/2 cup butter (In small pieces), on top.  Sprinkle 1/2 tablespoon of salt atop.  Place crust over everything.  Bake in the oven at 375 for 40 min.  Remove from oven when crust brown and pie is bubbly.  Enjoy.

goal: To bone a chicken thigh
sol1: Peel the skin off the chicken thigh using your fingers.Trim the excess yellow fat from the thigh with a paring knife. Flip over the thigh so that the rough side is up and locate the single bone that runs through it. Using the tip of the knife, score a line through the meat along the width of the bone. Expose the top of the bone by using the tip of your knife in short, flicking motions. Grasp one end of the bone with your non-knife hand (a little piece of paper towel can help if it's very slippery), then using the base of your knife, scrap the meat off of the bone in short, firm flicks. Separate the end of the bone completely from the meat. Trim away any gristle or bits of bone or cartilage that may have remained on the meat.
sol2: Peel the skin off the chicken thigh using your fingers.Trim the excess yellow fat from the thigh with a paring knife. Flip over the thigh so that the rough side is up and locate the single bone that runs through it. Using the tip of the knife, score a line through the meat along the length of the bone. Expose the top of the bone by using the tip of your knife in short, flicking motions. Grasp one end of the bone with your non-knife hand (a little piece of paper towel can help if it's very slippery), then using the base of your knife, scrap the meat off of the bone in short, firm flicks. Separate the end of the bone completely from the meat. Trim away any gristle or bits of bone or cartilage that may have remained on the meat.

goal: How do you grow Roses?
sol1: Roses crave sun, at least six hours a day is ideal. Plant roses in rich, non-draining soil. When planting, mix organic matter, such as compost or ground bark, into excavated soil you'll use to backfill the planting hole. Add a 2-3-inch layer of coarse, organic mulch around roses. Coarse mulch helps reduce foliage diseases on roses because it reduces the amount of water splashing onto leaves (splashing water drops can spread fungal diseases).
sol2: Roses crave sun, at least six hours a day is ideal. Plant roses in rich, well-draining soil. When planting, mix organic matter, such as compost or ground bark, into excavated soil you'll use to backfill the planting hole. Add a 2-3-inch layer of coarse, organic mulch around roses. Coarse mulch helps reduce foliage diseases on roses because it reduces the amount of water splashing onto leaves (splashing water drops can spread fungal diseases).

goal: How do I deter ants from my home?
sol1: If you want to deter ants from your home, clean your kitchen regularly and thoroughly. Make sure to clean areas that have sugar and grease residue. Ants are particularly attracted to the scent of sugar and grease. Be proactive and diligent by quickly cleaning any spills.
sol2: If you want to deter ants from your home, clean your kitchen very infrequently. Make sure to clean areas that have sugar and grease residue. Ants are particularly attracted to the scent of sugar and grease. Be proactive and diligent by quickly cleaning any spills.

goal: how to make kasha with sweet potatoes
sol1: Saute 1 chopped onion in butter in a pot over medium-high heat until browned. Add 3 cups chicken broth, 2 cups chopped peeled sweet potatoes and 3/4 cup kasha. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat, cover and simmer until the liquid is absorbed, 10 minutes. Stir in 4 ounces cooked bow-tie pasta and 1/4 cup each chopped parsley and sour cream; season with salt.
sol2: Saute 1 chopped onion in butter in a compact mini refrigerator over medium-high heat until browned. Add 3 cups chicken broth, 2 cups chopped peeled sweet potatoes and 3/4 cup kasha. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat, cover and simmer until the liquid is absorbed, 10 minutes. Stir in 4 ounces cooked bow-tie pasta and 1/4 cup each chopped parsley and sour cream; season with salt.

goal: To make a spooky glowing jar for Halloween
sol1: Clean a mason jar using rubbing alcohol and a soft cloth. Completely cover the jar by wrapping it with masking tape. Draw a spooky jack-o'-lantern design on the tape with a Sharpie. Carefully cut along the design using a razor knife, and remove the rest of the tape. Spray the jar with black spray paint--you might need to use two coats depending on the kind of paint you use. After the paint dries, carefully remove the tape. Very very carefully, in an open, well ventilated space and wearing protective gloves, use the razor knife to cut the top from a glow stick and pour the liquid into the mason jar, and then fasten the lid. Carefully dispose of the empty glow stick. Swirl the liquid around the jar, and it should glow for up to two hours.
sol2: Clean a mason jar using rubbing alcohol and a soft cloth. Completely cover the jar by wrapping it with masking tape. Draw a spooky jack-o'-lantern design on the tape with a Sharpie. Carefully cut the design out using a razor knife, leaving the rest of the tape still on the jar. Spray the jar with black spray paint--you might need to use two coats depending on the kind of paint you use. After the paint dries, carefully remove the tape. Very very carefully, in an open, well ventilated space and wearing protective gloves, use the razor knife to cut the top from a glow stick and pour the liquid into the mason jar, and then fasten the lid. Carefully dispose of the empty glow stick. Swirl the liquid around the jar, and it should glow for up to two hours.

goal: How does companion planting help reduce pests and increase production ?
sol1: Like nature, combining different types of plants will help neighboring plants in a symbolic fashion, by adding colour, and scents and other things that can attract snails and slugs, also giving the wasps food so all can survive together. For instance. planting rosemary, lemon basil or wormwood on the edge of the fruit or vegetable garden will keep pests out as the wind carries the scent and oils across the garden. Beneficial plants add nectars that attract and feed insects, yarrow foliage composts the soil naturally.

For instance. planting rosemary, lemon basil or wormwood on the edge of the fruit or vegetable garden will keep pests out as the wind carries the scent and oils across the garden. goal: How do you set up an aquarium for African Shell Dwelling Cichlids?
sol1: There several species of shell dwelling cichlids in the aquarium hobby. They are the smallest species of cichlids in the world, and they inhabit small empty snail shells at the bottom of Lake Tanganyika. To set up a tank for these little guys, you will want an aquarium of at least 20 gallons for a harem of 6 fish- 5 females and 1 male. These fish like harder water, so used crushed coral for the substrate as it ast like a buffer and raises the pH. Then you can buy Extra large escargot shells from a gourmet foods retailer, rinse them well, and sink them in the aquarium. Make sure your tank is completely cycled and add your fish.
sol2: There several species of shell dwelling cichlids in the aquarium hobby. They are the smallest species of cichlids in the world, and they inhabit small empty snail shells at the bottom of Lake Tanganyika. To set up a tank for these little guys, you will want an aquarium of at least 20 gallons for a harem of 6 fish- 5 females and 1 male. These fish like harder water, so used crushed coral for the substrate as it ast like a buffer and raises the pH. Then you can buy Extra small egg shells from a gourmet foods retailer, rinse them well, and sink them in the aquarium. Make sure your tank is completely cycled and add your fish.

You connect the braids by "sewing" the inside loops of the braids together. On the loop end, add a jump ring and clasp.
sol2: Use heavy duty pliers for the guitar strings, and smaller wire cutters for the wire. Bundle three guitar strings together, wire wrap with 20 gauge wire,and crimp the wire to flatten and secure. goal: How to Store Easy Homemade Butter in the refrigerator
sol1: To store Easy Homemade Butter in the refrigerator, take the lump of butter that remains in the bottom of the jar after you have poured off the buttermilk. Add a few inches of cold water, almost covering the butter in the bottom of the jar and shake again until the water looks cloudy. Pour this off and repeat, until the water after shaking remains clear. This will remove any further buttermilk so the butter doesn't spoil as quickly and can be stored in the refrigerator. Press out any remaining buttermilk and scrape the butter into a ball or bar shape. Wrap in parchment and store in the refrigerator.
sol2: To store Easy Homemade Butter in the refrigerator, take the lump of butter that remains in the bottom of the jar after you have poured off the buttermilk. Add a few inches of cold water, almost covering the butter in the bottom of the jar and shake again until the water looks cloudy. Pour this off and repeat, until the water after shaking remains clear. This will remove any further buttermilk so the butter doesn't spoils quicker and can be stored in the refrigerator. Press out any remaining buttermilk and scrape the butter into a ball or bar shape. Wrap in parchment and store in the refrigerator.

goal: How to make Chocolate Three Musketeers Bar Ice Cream at home.

Serve with chocolate sauce.
sol2: In a medium mixing bowl combine 4 cups chilled whipping cream, 14 oz. can sweetened condensed milk, and 1 16 ounce can chocolate flavored syrup (Like Hershey's). goal: How should you clean a bathtub?
sol1: To clean the tub, spray all the surfaces generously then sprinkle liberally with salt. It's hard to sprinkle vertical surfaces, so you can put some salt on a rag and rub it on the surface to make a paste. Leave this paste overnight (or an hour or two -- or less depending on how much oil is incrusted), then scrub off and clean with warm soapy water.
sol2: To clean the tub, spray all the surfaces generously then sprinkle liberally with baking soda. It's hard to sprinkle vertical surfaces, so you can put some baking soda on a rag and rub it on the surface to make a paste. Leave this paste overnight (or an hour or two -- or less depending on how much oil is incrusted), then scrub off and clean with warm soapy water.

goal: What safety precautions do I need to take when making a DIY rug?
sol1: Think about your safety! Make sure you are good prepared and use good tools before you begin! Cutting the carpet tiles is a job that you must take serious, because it’s a tough and durable material and needs a lot of force to be cut. Only use rulers that have edges ( to block the knife from leaving its direction and might hurt your hand ). Don’t do this project alone, for safety reasons. Use sharp blades since this will save a lot of your energy. The blades become blunt easily because of the strong backing of the tiles.
sol2: Think about your safety! Make sure you are good prepared and use good tools before you begin! Cutting the carpet tiles is a job that you must take serious, because it’s a tough and durable material and needs a lot of force to be cut. Only use rulers that have high edges ( to block the knife from leaving its direction and might hurt your hand ). Don’t do this project alone, for safety reasons. goal: to make homemade playdough

goal: zuchini linguine
sol1: 4 medium zucchini    100 grams pancetta chopped    1 cup pecorino cheese grated    2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil    Instructions    Using a vegetable peeler or spiralizer, peel a pile of ribbons from the zucchinis.    In a non-stick pan over medium high heat, add ½ tablespoon of oil and sauté the ribbons for 20 seconds on each side. Add the pancetta, half the cheese, and remaining oil and toss together.    Divide between 4 bowls. Sprinkle with remaining Pecorino and season with cracked pepper to serve.

goal: Is there an easy way to make a sparkly pendant?
sol1: You'll need borax crystals, hot water, a pot to boil the water in, a spoon, a pipe cleaner, some string, a pencil or long stick, and food coloring. Boil 6 cups of water and mix in 3 cups of borax washing crystals. Add your preferred food color and mix. Take your pipe cleaner and shape it into a spiral, or any shape you like. Tie one end of your string around the pipe cleaner shape and the other end around a pencil or stick that is longer than the container of colored water. Dangle the pipe cleaner all the way down into the colored water, make sure it doesn't rest on the bottom. Leave it overnight, and when you pull your pipe cleaner shape out it will be covered in gobs of sparkly crystals that will glimmer in the light.
sol2: Use washing soda for your hand-crafted pendants.

goal: How to Identify Ich or Ick (Ichthyophthirius Multifilis) in Freshwater Fish
sol1: Ich is the most common fish illness in the freshwater aquarium hobby. Luckily, it is pretty easy to treat. The first step is positively identifying the parasitic infection. The infection looks like grains of white sand or salt all over the fishes fins, gills and eventually scales. The finnage may also appear tattered, and the fish may display flashing behavior, which looks like it is scratching its body on the substrate or ornaments to itch a scratch. Eventually, without treatment, as the infection progresses, the parasites attach themselves to the gills and the fish will settle at the bottom gasping, and eventually expire.
sol2: Ich is the most common fish illness in the freshwater aquarium hobby. Luckily, it is pretty easy to treat. The first step is positively identifying the parasitic infection. The infection looks like grains of white sand or salt all over the fishes fins, gills and eventually scales. The finnage may also appear tattered, and the fish may display flashing behavior, which looks like it is scratching its body on the substrate or ornaments to itch a scratch. Eventually, without treatment, as the infection progresses, the parasites attach themselves to the gills and the fish will settle at the bottom gasping, and eventually recover.

goal: homemade sugar cookies
sol1: 3/4 cups (6oz/170g) butter, cubes and cold    1 cups (8oz/225g) sugar    2 eggs*    1 teaspoon vanilla extract    2 1/2 cups (12oz/340g) all-purpose flour    1 teaspoon baking powder    1 teaspoon salt    Instructions    In a food processor add in the flour, sugar, salt, and baking powder. Stir a little with a spatula        Add in the cold butter and blitz for seconds JUST until the mix looks like big bread crumbs    Whisk together the eggs and vanilla extract. Pour into the food processor and pulse for a few seconds until the dough comes together. Take care not to over mix. If your mix seems dry you can add a tiny bit more egg or milk.  (This dough can also be made by hand by rubbing in the butter into the flour)        Chill the dough for a minimum of 2-3 hours. Preferably chill overnight. Also it can be frozen at this stage for up to 8 weeks.         Once chilled, roll out some of the dough on a well floured surface to about 1/4-1/8 inch thick.         Cut out your desired shapes and transfer them to a baking tray lined with parchment. (this is a soft dough so work fast).    Bake at 325°F (160°C) for 18-20 minutes or until a light golden brown. Set aside to cool.        Decorate with royal icing if you wish and store in an airtight container for up to 7 days.
sol2: 3/4 cups (6oz/170g) butter, cubes and cold    1 cups (8oz/225g) sugar    2 eggs*    1 teaspoon vanilla extract    2 1/2 cups (12oz/340g) all-purpose flour    1 teaspoon baking powder    1 teaspoon salt    Instructions    In a food processor add in the flour, sugar, salt, and baking powder. Stir a little with a spatula        Add in the cold butter and blitz for seconds JUST until the mix looks like big bread crumbs    Whisk together the eggs and vanilla extract. Pour into the food processor and pulse for a few seconds until the dough comes together. Take care not to over mix. If your mix seems dry you can add a tiny bit more egg or milk.  (This dough can also be made by hand by rubbing in the butter into the flour)        Chill the dough for a minimum of 2-3 hours. Preferably chill overnight. Also it can be frozen at this stage for up to 8 weeks.         Once chilled, roll out some of the dough on a well floured surface to about 1/4-1/8 inch thick.         Cut out your desired shapes and transfer them to a baking tray lined with parchment. (this is a soft dough so work fast).    Bake at 325°F (160°C) for 120 minutes or until a light golden brown. Set aside to cool.        Decorate with royal icing if you wish and store in an airtight container for up to 7 days.

goal: How to make Raspberry Pine nut fudge at home.
sol1: Mix 3 cups granulated sugar,  3/4 cup margarine, and  2/3 cup evaporated milk in a large, heavy saucepan over medium heat, stirring to dissolve sugar. Bring mixture to a full boil for 5 minutes, stirring constantly.  Remove from heat and stir in 12 ounce semi sweet chocolate chips until melted and thoroughly combined. Beat in 1 7 ounce jar of marshmallow creme, 3/4 cup dried Raspberries, 1/4 cup Pine nuts and 1 teaspoon vanilla extract. Transfer fudge to Greased 8 x 13" pan and let cool before cutting into squares.
sol2: Mix 3 cups granulated sugar,  3/4 cup margarine, and  2/3 cup evaporated milk in a large, heavy saucepan over medium heat, stirring to dissolve sugar. Bring mixture to a full boil for 5 minutes, stirring constantly.  Remove from heat and stir in 12 ounce semi sweet chocolate chips until melted and thoroughly combined. Beat in 1 7 ounce jar of marshmallow creme, 3/4 cup dried Raspberries, 1/4 cup Pine bark and 1 teaspoon vanilla extract. Transfer fudge to Greased 8 x 13" pan and let cool before cutting into squares.

goal: How do you warm up a cold honeybee inside?
sol1: Carefully slide a stiff piece of paper underneath the bee to pick it up. Place the bee into a lidded container and cover it with saran wrap. Secure the saran wrap with a rubber band. Punch a few small holes into the saran wrap so the bee can get fresh air. Bring the container to a warm area indoors and give the bee time to warm up. Once the bee is active within the container, take the container outside, remove the saran wrap from the container, and release it.
sol2: Carefully slide a stiff piece of paper underneath the bee to pick it up. Place the bee into a lidded container and cover it with a piece of paper. Secure the paper with a rubber band. goal: How to make Chips Ahoy chocolate Chocolate chip cookie Ice Cream at home.

goal: How to make dulce de leche in an Instant Pot
sol1: Mix 1/2 teaspoon of baking soda with two tablespoons in water in a stainless steel bowl that will fit into the instant pot. Add one 300ml can of  condensed milk into the bowl with the baking soda mixture and mix with a whisk. Place the bowl into the Instant Pot and add one cup of water to the pot around it. Cook at high pressure for one hour, until the condensed milk mixture is deep brown. Carefully remove the bowl from the Instant Pot, and use a whisk to mix the cooked ingredients together. Pour into a clean glass jar and allow to cool.
sol2: Mix 1/2 teaspoon of baking soda with two tablespoons in water in a stainless steel bowl that will fit into the instant pot. Add one 300ml can of  condensed milk into the bowl with the baking soda mixture and mix with a whisk. Place the bowl into the Instant Pot, add one cup of water to the mix and one cup of water to the pot around the bowl. Cook at high pressure for one hour, until the condensed milk mixture is deep brown. Carefully remove the bowl from the Instant Pot, and use a whisk to mix the cooked ingredients together. Pour into a clean glass jar and allow to cool.

goal: How to make a pup tent out of a poncho?
sol1: Attach the 4’, loop-ended lines to the corners of the poncho using a loop-to-loop knot. Drive in four stakes out from where the corners will be. Run the long line over the poncho, clip a carabiner between the butterfly knots in the line and the midpoint loop or grommet at the end of the poncho. Now, make a Prusik knot on your poles, pass the loop through the straps, and clip it onto a carabiner. Stake out the loose ends of the long line to secure the “tent”. Tie down the four corners with your stakes.
sol2: Attach the 4’, loop-ended lines to the corners of the poncho using a loop-to-loop knot. Drive in four stakes out from where the corners will be. Run the long line UNDER the poncho, clip a carabiner between the butterfly knots in the line and the midpoint loop or grommet at the end of the poncho. Now, make a Prusik knot on your poles, pass the loop through the straps, and clip it onto a carabiner. Stake out the loose ends of the long line to secure the “tent”. Tie down the four corners with your stakes.

goal: How to make Apricot Cobbler at home.
sol1: Wash, peel and slice, 6 apricots  coat with 12 cups  Lemon Juice.  Use Pillsbury Cinnamon roll(tube type) from refrigerated section in the market, with rolling pin, roll to less than 1/2 inch thick.  Line the base of a deep metal baking pan/dish with the dough.  Reserve approx. 1/3 of dough for cover.  (You will place this on top after you finish preparing the filling.)  Place apricots in dish atop the roll dough.  Sprinkle 1 cup granulated sugar, 2 tbs. Brown sugar 1 tablespoons cinnamon, 1/2 cup butter (In small pieces), on top.  Sprinkle 1/2 tablespoon of salt atop.  Place crust over everything.  Bake in the oven at 375 for 40 min.  Remove from oven when crust brown and pie is bubbly.  Enjoy.
sol2: Wash, peel and slice, 6 apricots  coat with 1/4 cup Lemon Juice.  Use Pillsbury Cinnamon roll(tube type) from refrigerated section in the market, with rolling pin, roll to less than 1/2 inch thick.  Line the base of a deep metal baking pan/dish with the dough.  Reserve approx. 1/3 of dough for cover.  (You will place this on top after you finish preparing the filling.)  Place apricots in dish atop the roll dough.  Sprinkle 1 cup granulated sugar, 2 tbs. Brown sugar 1 tablespoons cinnamon, 1/2 cup butter (In small pieces), on top.  Sprinkle 1/2 tablespoon of salt atop.  Place crust over everything.  Bake in the oven at 375 for 40 min.  Remove from oven when crust brown and pie is bubbly.  Enjoy.

goal: How to keep a toddler's toys organized
sol1: Children can accumulate so many toys that it is difficult to keep them organized. I separate toys into several different large tupperware bins and I store them in my bedroom closet. I take out one bin a week, so the child does not get bored of the toys, and there aren't so many available to choose from that the child gets overwhelmed. Then at the end of the week, I go through and throw away any brand new toys or toys missing pieces, put that box away, and exchange it for a different one.
sol2: Children can accumulate so many toys that it is difficult to keep them organized. I separate toys into several different large tupperware bins and I store them in my bedroom closet. I take out one bin a week, so the child does not get bored of the toys, and there aren't so many available to choose from that the child gets overwhelmed. goal: Bake a holiday Cranberry/apple cobbler at home.
sol1: Peel and core 2 large or  3 medium apples (tart ones are best), Wash 2 cups fresh cranberries add with apples.  Slice the apple thinly, sprinkle with 1/4 cup Lemon Juice.  Use Pillsbury Cinnamon roll(tube type) from refrigerated section in the market, with rolling pin, roll to less than 1/2 inch thick.  Line the base of a deep metal baking pan/dish with the dough.  Reserve approx. 1/3 of dough for cover.  (You will place this on top after you finish preparing the filling.)  Place apples and cranberries in dish atop the roll dough.  Sprinkle 1 cup granulated sugar, 2 tbs. Brown sugar 2 tablespoons cinnamon, 1/2 cup butter (In small pieces), on top.  Sprinkle 1/2  pounds of salt atop.  Place crust over everything.  Bake in the oven at 375 for 40 min.  Remove from oven when crust brown and pie is bubbly.  Enjoy.
sol2: Peel and core 2 large or  3 medium apples (tart ones are best), Wash 2 cups fresh cranberries add with apples.  Slice the apple thinly, sprinkle with 1/4 cup Lemon Juice.  Use Pillsbury Cinnamon roll(tube type) from refrigerated section in the market, with rolling pin, roll to less than 1/2 inch thick.  Line the base of a deep metal baking pan/dish with the dough.  Reserve approx. 1/3 of dough for cover.  (You will place this on top after you finish preparing the filling.)  Place apples and cranberries in dish atop the roll dough.  Sprinkle 1 cup granulated sugar, 2 tbs. Brown sugar 2 tablespoons cinnamon, 1/2 cup butter (In small pieces), on top.  Sprinkle 1/2 tablespoon of salt atop.  Place crust over everything.  Bake in the oven at 375 for 40 min.  Remove from oven when crust brown and pie is bubbly.  Enjoy.

goal: How to make Cinnamon roll Peach Cobbler in your own kitchen.
sol1: Wash, peel and slice, 4 Peaches coat with 1/8 cup Lemon Juice. goal: How do you make a juicer out of a can to juice berries with?
sol1: Empty out a soup can and clean it. Get a 1 inch long nail and a hammer. Flip the can upside down and place the nail tip down on the center of the bottom of the can. Hold the nail steady with one hand and raise the hammer above the nail with the other hand. Swiftly swing the hammer down face-first onto the top of the nail, pushing it through the bottom of the can. Pull the nail out and repeat about 150-200 times, until there are many small holes in the bottom of the can.
sol2: Empty out a soup can and clean it. Get a 1 inch long nail and a hammer. Flip the can upside down and place the nail tip down on the center of the bottom of the can. goal: Paint and stain your plane.

goal: What are the steps to take to change the oil in your car?

goal: How do I make a lamp using plywood supplies?
sol1: The first step to making the lamp is constructing the molds, which the plywood is clamped around. Once the curved is marked, cut it out with a jigsaw (or bandsaw or handsaw) keeping as close to the line as possible. Then cut 4 strips of the 6mm plywood at 62mm x 1300mm. Then 4 strips at 25mm x 1300mm. I used the table saw. The legs are glued, screwed and doweled into the half laps. To feed the cord up through the lamp, I had to unwire it from the socket.

goal: To press flowers using a book

goal: To make a gravity water pipe.
sol1: Take a scissor and cut the bottom off of a soda bottle. Unscrew the cap from the bottle and melt a hole in the top with a soldering iron. Next take a screen and push it through the hole. Screw it back on. Fill up a bucket with water. Put your new water pipe inside and make sure it's loaded with your favorite tobacco. Light the top with a blowtorch and pull the bottle up to draw smoke in the chamber. Unscrew the cap and push the bottle down in the water to shotgun the smoke.
sol2: Take a scissor and cut the bottom off of a soda bottle. Unscrew the cap from the bottle and melt a hole in the top with a soldering iron. Next take a screen and push it through the hole. goal: How to correctly plant carrot seeds.
sol1: Always use fresh seeds, and good fertile soil. Carrots need pliable soil with out a lot of rocks which may stunt or twist the root, which is the edible part of the plant. To plant seeds, make one inch holes about 3 inches apart in rows. cover with a bit of soil and water. Keep the soil moderately hydrated and within a few weeks the shoots will begin to appear. In a few more weeks, the roots will be long enough to begin to harvest and enjoy.
sol2: Always use fresh radish seeds to make good firm carrots. Remove any rocks or other debris from the soil so it is free of obstructions that may stunt or twist the roots as they develop. The root is the edible part of the vegetable. To plant the seeds make small indentations, place a seed in the well, and cover with soil, planting in rows about 3 inches apart. Water moderately and in a couple of weeks the shoots will begin to show.

goal: Adhere a magnet to a measuring tape.

sol2: To adhere a magnet to a measuring tape, you should use contact cement on the measuring tape on the magnet.  Let each air dry until tacky, then carefully press the magnet onto the measuring tape and apply pressure to finalize the bond.

goal: How do you make buttercream frosting
sol1: In medium bowl, mix powdered sugar and butter with spoon or electric mixer on low speed. Stir in vanilla and 1 tablespoon of the milk. Gradually beat in just enough remaining milk to make frosting smooth and spreadable. If frosting is too thick, beat in more milk, a few drops at a time.
sol2: In medium bowl, mix powdered sugar and butter with spoon or electric mixer on low speed. Stir in vanilla and 1 tablespoon of the milk. Gradually beat in just enough remaining butter to make frosting smooth and spreadable. If frosting is too thick, beat in more milk, a few drops at a time.

goal: To make royal icing
sol1: Mix together two tablespoons meringue powder and six teaspoons water in a large bowl and use a stand mixer with the whisk attachment to whip until foamy. Add  2 2/3 cups powdered sugar and whip on medium speed until very stiff. Whip in the gel paste icing colors of your choosing, and thin with water a drop at a time to get the perfect consistency for your royal icing.
sol2: Mix together two tablespoons meringue powder and six tablespoons water in a large bowl and use a stand mixer with the whisk attachment to whip until foamy. Add  2 2/3 cups powdered sugar and whip on medium speed until very stiff. Whip in the gel paste icing colors of your choosing, and thin with water a drop at a time to get the perfect consistency for your royal icing.
